description: Build a full-stack task management application with React frontend, Node.js backend, and PostgreSQL database. Users can create, update, delete, and organize tasks into projects.

userStories.title: Database schema for tasks and projects
userStories.description: As a developer, I want a database schema so that we can store tasks and projects persistently
acceptanceCriteria: Create migration for projects table (id, name, description, created_at, updated_at)
Create migration for tasks table (id, project_id, title, description, status, priority, due_date, created_at, updated_at)
Add foreign key constraint from tasks.project_id to projects.id
Add indexes on frequently queried columns
userStories.notes: Foundation for the entire app. Must be done first.

userStories.title: API endpoint: Create project
userStories.description: As a user, I want to create a new project so that I can organize my tasks
acceptanceCriteria: Accepts JSON body with name and description

userStories.title: API endpoint: List projects
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see all my projects so that I can choose which one to work on
acceptanceCriteria: Includes project id, name, description, timestamps

userStories.title: API endpoint: Create task
userStories.description: As a user, I want to create a task within a project so that I can track what needs to be done
acceptanceCriteria: Accepts JSON body with title, description, priority, due_date

userStories.title: API endpoint: List tasks for project
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see all tasks in a project so that I know what work remains
acceptanceCriteria: Returns array of tasks for the specified project
Returns 200 with empty array if no tasks

userStories.title: API endpoint: Update task status
userStories.description: As a user, I want to update a task's status so that I can mark it as in-progress or complete
acceptanceCriteria: Accepts JSON body with status field

userStories.title: Frontend: Project list page
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see a page listing all my projects so that I can navigate to them
acceptanceCriteria: Display project name and description in cards
Show error message if fetch fails
Click on project navigates to project detail page
userStories.notes: Depends on US-003. First UI component.

userStories.title: Frontend: Create project form
userStories.description: As a user, I want a form to create new projects so that I can organize my work
acceptanceCriteria: Form has name and description fields
Submit button disabled when name is empty
Redirect to project list after creation

userStories.title: Frontend: Task list component
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see all tasks in a project so that I can manage them
acceptanceCriteria: Display tasks in a list or kanban board
Show task title, description, priority, due date
Show empty state if no tasks

userStories.title: Frontend: Create task form
userStories.description: As a user, I want to create tasks in a project so that I can track work items
acceptanceCriteria: Form has title, description, priority, due_date fields
Priority is dropdown: low, medium, high

userStories.title: Frontend: Update task status via drag-and-drop
userStories.description: As a user, I want to drag tasks between columns to update their status
acceptanceCriteria: Dragging task to different column updates status
Optimistic UI update (move immediately, rollback on error)
Show error message if update fails

userStories.title: API endpoint: Delete task
userStories.description: As a user, I want to delete tasks that are no longer needed

userStories.title: Frontend: Delete task button
userStories.description: As a user, I want to delete tasks by clicking a button
acceptanceCriteria: Add delete button to each task in TaskList
Remove task from UI on success

userStories.title: End-to-end test: Create project and add tasks
userStories.description: As a developer, I want E2E tests to ensure the full workflow works
acceptanceCriteria: E2E test: Navigate to project list
E2E test: Navigate to project detail
E2E test: Drag task to in-progress
E2E test: Drag task to done
userStories.notes: Comprehensive E2E test. Run after all features complete.

userStories.title: Documentation: API reference
userStories.description: As a developer, I want API documentation so that I can understand all endpoints
userStories.notes: Documentation story. Can run in parallel with other work.
